decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's board and resources through a combination of removal spells, land manipulation, and powerful creatures. By using cards like Analyze the Pollen, Elspeth's Smite, Get Lost, and Leyline Binding, the player aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up their own board presence with Overlord creatures and other threats. The deck also includes a variety of utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Floodfarm Verge to ensure consistency and flexibility in gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through strategic control tactics.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Heartfire Hero and Emberheart Challenger, along with removal spells like Torch the Tower and Monstrous Rage, you can deal damage to your opponent quickly. The deck also includes cards like Innkeeper's Talent and Soulstone Sanctuary to help maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before your opponent can stabilize.

This Esper Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Spiteful Hexmage and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to apply early pressure, combined with disruptive spells like Go for the Throat and Hopeless Nightmare to control the board, this deck aims to maintain tempo and close out games quickly. With a blend of efficient creatures and removal spells, along with disruptive enchantments like Fear of Isolation and Stormchaser's Talent, this deck can disrupt opponents' game plans while pushing for a fast victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Omniscience Combo as quickly as possible to gain a massive advantage over the opponent. This is achieved by using cards like Invasion of Arcavios and Adarkar Wastes to generate mana and draw cards, while also utilizing cards like Picklock Prankster and Fallaji Archaeologist to help set up the combo pieces. Once Omniscience is on the battlefield, the deck can quickly close out the game with powerful spells such as Moment of Truth and Ephara's Dispersal.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence with aggressive creature cards. It utilizes cards like Temporary Lockdown and Unsummon to control the battlefield, while using effects like Helping Hand and Recommission to keep up card advantage. Founding the Third Path and Soul Partition provide additional creatures to pressure the opponent, supported by cards like Chart a Course for card draw. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Haughty Djinn to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive early game creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner to control the board and Fear of Isolation to restrict the opponent's resources, the player can maintain pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Kaito, Bane of Nightmares serves as a powerful finisher, while Stormchaser's Talent and This Town Ain't Big Enough provide additional card advantage and versatility. The deck aims to constantly apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to achieve victory.

The main concept of this Esper Control deck is to focus on disruption and removal, utilizing cards like Destroy Evil and No More Lies to control the opponent's board. The deck also includes a mix of creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Nurturing Pixie for added defense and offense. The land base is designed to provide a good mix of colors for casting various spells. The overall strategy is to outlast the opponent and control the game until victory is achieved.

This control deck focuses on using powerful Overlord creatures to dominate the board while utilizing various Verge lands to ensure mana consistency. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and ramp options to maintain control over the game. With a mixture of powerful creatures and versatile spells, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Omniscience combo by playing cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Invasion of Arcavios to cheat out Omniscience onto the battlefield. Once Omniscience is in play, the deck aims to cast spells for free, using cards like Ephara's Dispersal and Confounding Riddle to control the board while drawing cards and setting up for a game-winning turn. The deck also includes disruption and card draw spells to help find pieces of the combo and protect the key combo pieces.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on establishing board presence quickly with aggressive creatures like Pawpatch Recruit and Sanguine Evangelist. The deck also includes cards like Wilt-Leaf Liege and Bramble Familiar to pump up your creatures and make them more difficult to deal with. The inclusion of cards like Collector's Cage and Sheltered by Ghosts helps protect your key creatures from removal spells, allowing you to maintain your offensive pressure. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and powerful creature-based strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards that deal direct damage and disrupt opponent's plans. The deck aims to control the board early with efficient creatures like Clockwork Percussionist and Spiteful Hexmage while also burning the opponent with cards like Torch the Tower and Final Vengeance. Tinybones Joins Up provides card advantage while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse acts as a powerful finisher. The deck also includes support cards like Nowhere to Run and Urabrask's Forge to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes cards like Heartfire Hero, Emberheart Challenger, and Manifold Mouse to put pressure on the opponent early on. Questing Druid and Hired Claw provide additional creatures to keep the pressure up. Monstrous Rage and Torch the Tower serve as removal and direct damage spells to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Innkeeper's Talent and Soulstone Sanctuary help to keep the deck's momentum going by providing card draw and extra resources.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Season of Loss, Rubblebelt Maverick, and Overlord of the Balemurk, along with efficient removal spells like Overwhelming Remorse, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control. With a focus on creatures that can quickly grow in power, such as Urborg Lhurgoyf and Huskburster Swarm, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The land base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with a mix of mana-fixing and utility lands.

The main idea of this Aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Hired Claw, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to apply constant pressure to the opponent while quickly reducing their life total. With a focus on quick and powerful attacks, supported by cards like Monstrous Rage and Soulstone Sanctuary, the deck aims to secure a fast victory before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Aggro Dimir deck is to consistently apply pressure on the opponent with a combination of disruptive spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly through cards like Hopeless Nightmare and Stormchaser's Talent. The inclusion of control spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down helps to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on staying ahead in tempo and punishing the opponent for any missteps.
